summary: This is an email from a US Attorney's Office regarding a draft indictment against Ghislaine Maxwell. The email discusses a legal issue concerning the perjury charge related to Maxwell's testimony about a minor victim's age, and the need to protect the victim's identity while complying with legal requirements.

persons.name: Graff, Ilan
persons.context: Appears as a recipient (Cc) of an email discussing the draft Maxwell indictment and legal strategy regarding victim anonymity.

persons.name: Maxwell
persons.context: The subject of the draft indictment, specifically concerning a perjury charge related to her testimony about a minor victim's age.

persons.name: Minor Victim-1
persons.context: A minor victim referenced in Maxwell's deposition transcript; the email discusses protecting this individual's identity in the indictment.

connections.description: Maxwell's testimony about the minor victim's age is the subject of a perjury charge in the draft indictment.

events.title: Draft Maxwell Indictment Prepared
events.description: A draft indictment against Ghislaine Maxwell is circulated among prosecutors, including discussion of a perjury charge related to her testimony about a minor victim.

keyFacts: A draft indictment against Ghislaine Maxwell was being prepared as of June 11, 2020.
The indictment included a perjury charge (Count Five) related to Maxwell's testimony about a minor victim's age.
Prosecutors were concerned that including the full transcript excerpt would allow anyone with access to the deposition to identify 'Minor Victim-1', undermining promises to protect her identity.
The legal team sought to either further anonymize the reference or remove that specification from the indictment to protect the victim.
